results.title: The $1.28 Billion Mega Millions Jackpot and You
results.abstract: On Friday night, these were the winning numbers: 67, 45, 57, 36, 13 and the Mega Ball, 14. Here’s what else you need to know.

media.caption: A Mega Millions lottery ticket at a 7-Eleven convenience store in Chino Hills, Calif., on Thursday.

results.adx_keywords: Oceans and Seas;Fish and Other Marine Life;Volcanoes;National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration;Atlantic Ocean;Azores Islands
results.title: There Are Holes on the Ocean Floor. Scientists Don’t Know Why.
results.abstract: Similar openings on the sea floor were first spotted 18 years ago along the Mid-Atlantic Ridge. Their origins remain unknown. Scientists are asking the public for their thoughts.

media.caption: While researchers explored the Mid-Atlantic Ridge on July 23, they noticed sets of holes in the sediment that they couldn’t explain. The laser points in the image are 10 centimeters. or about 4 inches, apart.

results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Vaccination and Immunization;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Coronavirus Omicron Variant;United States Politics and Government;Food and Drug Administration;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;Moderna Inc;Pfizer Inc
results.byline: By Noah Weiland and Sharon LaFraniere
results.title: Biden Administration Plans to Offer Updated Booster Shots in September
results.abstract: With reformulated shots from Pfizer and Moderna on the horizon, the F.D.A. has decided that Americans under 50 should wait to receive second boosters.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: The new versions are expected to perform better against the now-dominant Omicron subvariant BA.5, although the data available so far is still preliminary.
media.copyright: Erika P. Rodriguez for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Renting and Leasing (Real Estate);Jersey City (NJ)
results.title: Which City Is Most Expensive for Renters? You Might Be Surprised.
results.abstract: With a spate of new luxury developments luring tenants from across the Hudson River, Jersey City has made itself the priciest city in the nation.

media.caption: The Hudson River waterfront in Jersey City, N.J., has seen a crop of luxury high-rises sprout up in recent years, along with a sculpture by the artist Jaume Plensa, “Water’s Soul.” (2020).

results.title: Why Do I Sweat So Much in My Sleep?
results.abstract: There are many possible reasons you might wake up in a pool of perspiration. Here’s how to tell when it should be cause for concern.

media.copyright: Eric Helgas for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Sailboats and Sailing;High Net Worth Individuals;Bridges and Tunnels;Boats and Boating;Bezos, Jeffrey P;Rotterdam (Netherlands)
results.title: The Country That Wants to ‘Be Average’ vs. Jeff Bezos and His $500 Million Yacht
results.abstract: Why did Rotterdam stand between one of the world’s richest men and his boat? The furious response is rooted in Dutch values.

media.caption: The Hef Bridge, in Rotterdam, Netherlands, was decommissioned as a railroad bridge in the early 1990s. A request to briefly dismantle the middle span was withdrawn in the face of protests.
media.copyright: Ilvy Njiokiktjien for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Accidents and Safety;Pop and Rock Music;Mirror (Music Group);Hong Kong;China
results.title: Large Video Screen Falls During Mirror Concert in Hong Kong, Injuring 2
results.abstract: Two dancers for the popular boy band were hospitalized, a local news outlet reported. Hong Kong officials promised an investigation.

media.caption: Video on social media showed a video screen falling during Mirror’s performance at the Hong Kong Coliseum on Thursday night.

results.adx_keywords: Animal Abuse, Rights and Welfare;Dogs;Research;Breeding of Animals;Envigo RMS LLC;Humane Society of the United States;United States;Virginia
results.byline: By April Rubin and Jesus Jiménez
results.title: 4,000 Mistreated Beagles Need Homes. These Folks Are Stepping Up.
results.abstract: The dogs were headed for testing labs and didn’t even have names or know how to play. Volunteers are introducing them to grassy yards and cuddly movie nights for the first time.
org_facet: Humane Society of the United States

media.caption: “Everything, from the way that grass feels to watching cars drive by, it’s all going to be a brand-new experience for them,” said Lindsay Hamrick of the Humane Society of the United States.

results.adx_keywords: Golf;Trump, Donald J;LIV Golf;Trump National Golf Club (Bedminster, NJ)
results.title: Watching Trump Play Golf: Decent Drives, Skipped Putts, Lots of Sweat
results.abstract: The former president’s barge-ahead style and whim for scooping up shots too hard to make wouldn’t fly on the LIV Golf series, which his Bedminster club is hosting this weekend.

media.caption: Donald J. Trump played in a pro-am tournament on the eve of a LIV Golf event at his club in Bedminster, N.J.

results.adx_keywords: Vitamin D;Osteoporosis;Bones;Bone Fractures;Preventive Medicine;Clinical Trials;Research;Cummings, Steven R;Rosen, Clifford J;New England Journal of Medicine
results.title: Study Finds Another Condition That Vitamin D Pills Do Not Help
results.abstract: The vitamin pills do not prevent bone fractures in most people or protect against many other diseases, adding to questions about medical guidance many now take for granted.

media.caption: A study of nearly 26,000 people who were assigned to take vitamin D each day found the vitamin had no effect, even among people who had low vitamin D levels or osteoporosis.

results.title: The Default Tech Settings You Should Turn Off Right Away
results.abstract: These controls, which are buried inside products from Apple, Google, Meta and others, make us share more data than we need to.

results.byline: By Emily Cochrane and Annie Karni
results.title: After Clash, Manchin and Schumer Rushed to Reset Climate and Tax Deal
results.abstract: The West Virginia Democrat said he had relented and agreed to sign on to a climate, energy and tax package after returning to negotiations to draft a version that would combat inflation.

media.caption: Senator Joe Manchin III of West Virginia had been the chief Democratic holdout on the climate, energy and tax package, the centerpiece of President Biden’s domestic policy plan.

results.title: The Dog Lawyer Doesn’t Care That You Hate Him
results.abstract: In defending dogs at all costs, Richard Rosenthal has made a lot of enemies. But his animal clients owe him their lives.

media.caption: Richard Rosenthal, with his greyhounds Bugsy and Louis, has made a specialty of defending dangerous dogs.
media.copyright: Johnny Milano for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Content Type: Personal Profile;Baseball;Sporting Goods and Equipment;Soil;audio-neutral-immersive;audio-positive-escape;audio-positive-nostalgic;Major League Baseball;Delaware River;New Jersey
results.title: He’s Baseball’s Only Mud Supplier. It’s a Job He May Soon Lose.
results.abstract: Jim Bintliff collects the Delaware River mud that is smeared on Major League baseballs to make them less slippery. But that tradition is in jeopardy.

media.caption: Jim Bintliff and his family have been selling Delaware River mud to Major League Baseball for decades. Here, he fills a bucket in New Jersey.
media.copyright: Hannah Beier for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Homosexuality and Bisexuality;Monkeypox;Epidemics;Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Men and Boys;New York City
results.title: ‘It’s Scary’: Gay Men Confront a Health Crisis With Echoes of the Past
results.abstract: Monkeypox has sparked frustration and anxiety among gay and bisexual men in New York, who remember mistakes and discrimination during the early years of the AIDS crisis.

media.caption: Kelvin Ehigie, right, a bartender at 4West in Harlem, worries about the monkeypox outbreak and the confusion it’s creating in the gay community.
media.copyright: Sara Naomi Lewkowicz for The New York Times

results.title: Russian National Charged With Spreading Propaganda Through U.S. Groups
results.abstract: Federal authorities say the man recruited several American political groups and used them to sow discord and interfere with elections.

media.caption: In Florida, Roger B. Handberg, a U.S. attorney, spoke to reporters on Friday along with Anthony Holloway, chief of the St. Petersburg police, left, and David Walker, of the F.B.I., right.

results.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Ava Sasani
results.title: An Indiana Doctor Speaks Out on Abortion, and Pays a Price
results.abstract: Dr. Caitlin Bernard, who provided an abortion to a 10-year-old, says doctors shouldn’t be silent. But she finds herself at the center of a post-Roe clash shaking the medical community.

media.caption: Dr. Caitlin Bernard, an Indianapolis obstetrician-gynecologist, gained national attention for providing abortion care to a 10-year-old rape victim.
media.copyright: Amanda Andrade-Rhoades for The New York Times

results.title: Three Pressing Questions About Monkeypox: Spread, Vaccination, Treatment
results.abstract: Containing the outbreak, scientists say, will depend on better understanding the virus’s transmission and how well available tools work.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: A man receives a monkeypox vaccination at the Northwell Health Immediate Care Center at Fire Island-Cherry Grove, in New York.
